New Records: Oklahoma City Thunder achieved a 15-game win streak
Key Match Events: Thunder defense held stout, holding the Celtics to a season-low 27 points in the first half
Oklahoma City held Boston to 92 points on the day and force 16 turnovers
Thunder thrived off the Paycom Center energy and continued to wreak havoc defensively
11 steals on the night and 13 fast break points on the game significantly helped OKC to mount its ultimate 13-point win
Post-Match Reflections: Oklahoma City will look to sustain its win streak against the first-seeded Eastern Conference Cleveland Cavaliers at 6 p.m. on Wednesday on the road
Miscellaneous Highlights: Boston Celtics' dependability on the outside shot leaves a lot of room for error
Celtics' 3-point inefficiency played a big part in their eventual loss
Oklahoma City seems to be quite comfortable in either come-from-behind or close-game situations
Others: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 33 points on 11-for-23 shooting
Derrick White shot 2-for-11 from beyond the arc
